   398    def warm_cache(
   399        self,
   400        repo_url: str,
   401        condition: Condition,
   402        model: str | None = None,
   403        timeout: int = 900
   404    ) -> SkillGenerationMetrics | None:
   405        """Pre-generate context files once per repo+condition into the cache.
   406
   407        Context files (AGENTS.md, CLAUDE.md) describe repo structure and
   408        conventions, which are stable across nearby commits. So we generate
   409        from the default branch once and reuse for all tasks in the repo.
   410
   411        Called once per unique (repo, condition) before the task loop.
   412        Subsequent task runs restore from the repo-level cache entry.
   413        Uses a longer timeout (default 900s) since this only runs once.
   414
   415        Returns SkillGenerationMetrics if generation was needed, None for the
   416        'none' condition (which has no context files to generate).
   417        """
   418        if condition == Condition.NONE:
   419            return None
   420
   421        cond_key = condition.value
   422
   423        # Already cached at repo level? Nothing to do.
   424        if self.index_cache:
   425            if self.index_cache.lookup_repo(repo_url, cond_key):
   426                logger.info("Cache hit for %s (%s), skipping warm", repo_url, condition.value)
   427                return None
   428
   429        # Clone default branch for generation (structure is commit-agnostic)
   430        repo_name = repo_url.split("/")[-1].replace(".git", "")
   431        workspace_name = f"{repo_name}-{condition.value}-warmup"
   432        workspace = str(self.workspaces_dir / workspace_name)
   433
   434        if Path(workspace).exists():
   435            shutil.rmtree(workspace)
   436
   437        try:
   438            self._progress("warmup", condition.value, "clone", f"cloning {repo_url}")
   439            clone_repo(repo_url, workspace, shallow=False)
   440            # Use default branch HEAD  no checkout_commit needed
   441
   442            self._progress("warmup", condition.value, "strip", "removing existing context files")
   443            strip_extra = self.repo.strip_extra or None
   444            self._strip_context_files(workspace, strip_extra)
   445
   446            self._progress("warmup", condition.value, "generate", f"generating {condition.value} context (timeout={timeout}s)")
   447            if condition == Condition.INTENT_LAYER:
   448                metrics = self._check_or_generate_index(
   449                    workspace=workspace,
   450                    repo_url=repo_url,
   451                    commit="latest",
   452                    condition=cond_key,
   453                    model=model,
   454                    timeout=timeout,
   455                    repo_level=True
   456                )
   457            else:  # FLAT_LLM
   458                metrics = self._generate_flat_context(
   459                    workspace=workspace,
   460                    repo_url=repo_url,
   461                    commit="latest",
   462                    model=model,
   463                    timeout=timeout,
   464                    repo_level=True
   465                )
   466
   467            if not metrics.cache_hit and not metrics.files_created:
   468                raise SkillGenerationError(
   469                    f"{condition.value} generation produced no files "
   470                    f"(took {metrics.wall_clock_seconds:.0f}s). "
   471                    f"Likely timed out or failed silently."
   472                )
   473
   474            status = "cached" if metrics.cache_hit else f"generated {len(metrics.files_created)} file(s)"
   475            self._progress("warmup", condition.value, "done", f"{status} in {metrics.wall_clock_seconds:.1f}s")
   476            return metrics
   477
   478        finally:
   479            # Clean up warmup workspace  the files are in the cache now
   480            if Path(workspace).exists():
   481                shutil.rmtree(workspace)
   482
   483    def run(self, task: Task, condition: Condition, model: str | None = None, rep: int = 0) -> TaskResult:
   484        """Execute a single task under the given condition."""
   485        cond_str = condition.value
   486        self._progress(task.id, cond_str, "setup", "creating workspace")
   487        workspace = self._setup_workspace(task, condition, rep=rep)
   488
   489        try:
   490            # Setup: clone and checkout
   491            self._progress(task.id, cond_str, "clone", f"cloning {self.repo.url}")
   492            clone_repo(self.repo.url, workspace, shallow=False)
   493            self._progress(task.id, cond_str, "checkout", f"checking out {task.pre_fix_commit[:8]}")
   494            checkout_commit(workspace, task.pre_fix_commit)
   495
   496            # Strip context files (all conditions  paper's methodology)
   497            self._progress(task.id, cond_str, "strip", "removing existing context files")
   498            strip_extra = self.repo.strip_extra or None
   499            removed = self._strip_context_files(workspace, strip_extra)
   500            if removed:
   501                self._progress(task.id, cond_str, "strip_done", f"removed {len(removed)} file(s)")
   502
   503            # Inject test file from fix commit for failing_test tasks.
   504            # Many repos add test functions alongside code fixes, so the test
   505            # file at pre_fix_commit passes (the bug-reproducing tests haven't
   506            # been written yet). Injecting fix_commit's version gives us
   507            # those functions, which fail because the code hasn't been fixed.
   508            if task.prompt_source == "failing_test" and task.test_file:
   509                if self._inject_test_from_fix(task, workspace):
   510                    self._progress(task.id, cond_str, "inject_test",
   511                                   f"injected {task.test_file} from fix commit")
   512
   513            # Pre-validate: confirm test infra works and test actually fails
   514            self._progress(task.id, cond_str, "pre_validate", "verifying test fails at pre_fix_commit")
   515            pre_validate_output = self._pre_validate(task, workspace)
   516            self._progress(task.id, cond_str, "pre_validate_done", "pre-validation passed")
   517
   518            # Generate context based on condition
   519            skill_metrics = None
   520
   521            if condition == Condition.INTENT_LAYER:
   522                log_dir = Path(self.workspaces_dir).parent / "logs"
   523                repo_slug = self.repo.url.split("/")[-1].replace(".git", "")
   524                skill_log = log_dir / f"{repo_slug}-{task.pre_fix_commit[:8]}-skill_gen.log"
   525                self._progress(task.id, cond_str, "skill_gen", f"checking cache or generating Intent Layer... (tail -f {skill_log})")
   526                skill_metrics = self._check_or_generate_index(
   527                    workspace=workspace,
   528                    repo_url=self.repo.url,
   529                    commit=task.pre_fix_commit,
   530                    condition=condition.value,
   531                    model=model
   532                )
   533                if not skill_metrics.cache_hit and not skill_metrics.files_created:
   534                    raise SkillGenerationError(
   535                        f"Intent Layer generation produced no files "
   536                        f"(took {skill_metrics.wall_clock_seconds:.0f}s). "
   537                        f"Likely timed out or failed silently."
   538                    )
   539                cache_status = "restored from cache" if skill_metrics.cache_hit else "generated"
   540                self._progress(task.id, cond_str, "skill_gen_done", f"{cache_status} {len(skill_metrics.files_created)} file(s) in {skill_metrics.wall_clock_seconds:.1f}s")
   541
   542            elif condition == Condition.FLAT_LLM:
   543                log_dir = Path(self.workspaces_dir).parent / "logs"
   544                repo_slug = self.repo.url.split("/")[-1].replace(".git", "")
   545                flat_log = log_dir / f"{repo_slug}-{task.pre_fix_commit[:8]}-flat_gen.log"
   546                self._progress(task.id, cond_str, "flat_gen", f"checking cache or generating flat CLAUDE.md... (tail -f {flat_log})")
   547                skill_metrics = self._generate_flat_context(
   548                    workspace=workspace,
   549                    repo_url=self.repo.url,
   550                    commit=task.pre_fix_commit,
   551                    model=model
   552                )
   553                if not skill_metrics.cache_hit and not skill_metrics.files_created:
   554                    raise SkillGenerationError(
   555                        f"Flat CLAUDE.md generation produced no files "
   556                        f"(took {skill_metrics.wall_clock_seconds:.0f}s). "
   557                        f"Likely timed out or failed silently."
   558                    )
   559                cache_status = "restored from cache" if skill_metrics.cache_hit else "generated"
   560                self._progress(task.id, cond_str, "flat_gen_done", f"{cache_status} {len(skill_metrics.files_created)} file(s) in {skill_metrics.wall_clock_seconds:.1f}s")
   561
   562            # NONE: no generation, stripping already happened
   563
   564            # Baseline commit: snapshot workspace state so diff stats
   565            # only measure changes made by Claude, not by the harness
   566            create_baseline_commit(workspace)
   567
   568            # Build prompt with condition-appropriate preamble
   569            self._progress(task.id, cond_str, "prompt", "building prompt")
   570            prompt = self._build_prompt(task, workspace, condition, cached_test_output=pre_validate_output)
   571
   572            # Run Claude on the task
   573            log_dir = Path(self.workspaces_dir).parent / "logs"
   574            repo_slug = self.repo.url.split("/")[-1].replace(".git", "")
   575            fix_log = log_dir / f"{repo_slug}-{task.pre_fix_commit[:8]}-{cond_str}-fix.log"
   576            self._progress(task.id, cond_str, "claude", f"running Claude to fix the bug... (tail -f {fix_log})")
   577            claude_result = run_claude(workspace, prompt, model=model,
   578                                       stderr_log=str(fix_log))
   579            self._progress(task.id, cond_str, "claude_done", f"completed in {claude_result.wall_clock_seconds:.1f}s, {claude_result.tool_calls} tool calls")
   580
   581            # Detect empty runs: Claude returned without doing any work
   582            if (claude_result.tool_calls == 0
   583                    and claude_result.input_tokens == 0
   584                    and claude_result.output_tokens == 0
   585                    and not claude_result.timed_out):
   586                # Include stderr for diagnosis  often reveals why CLI failed
   587                stderr_snippet = claude_result.stderr.strip()[:200] if claude_result.stderr else ""
   588                stderr_info = f", stderr={stderr_snippet!r}" if stderr_snippet else ""
   589                prompt_size = len(prompt.encode("utf-8"))
   590                return TaskResult(
   591                    task_id=task.id,
   592                    condition=condition,
   593                    success=False,
   594                    test_output="",
   595                    wall_clock_seconds=claude_result.wall_clock_seconds,
   596                    input_tokens=0,
   597                    output_tokens=0,
   598                    tool_calls=0,
   599                    lines_changed=0,
   600                    files_touched=[],
   601                    error=(
   602                        f"[empty-run] Claude produced no output "
   603                        f"(exit_code={claude_result.exit_code}, "
   604                        f"{claude_result.wall_clock_seconds:.1f}s, "
   605                        f"prompt_bytes={prompt_size}{stderr_info})"
   606                    ),
   607                    exit_code=claude_result.exit_code,
   608                )
   609
   610            # Detect timeout: Claude ran out of time
   611            if claude_result.timed_out:
   612                return TaskResult(
   613                    task_id=task.id,
   614                    condition=condition,
   615                    success=False,
   616                    test_output="",
   617                    wall_clock_seconds=claude_result.wall_clock_seconds,
   618                    input_tokens=claude_result.input_tokens,
   619                    output_tokens=claude_result.output_tokens,
   620                    tool_calls=claude_result.tool_calls,
   621                    lines_changed=0,
   622                    files_touched=[],
   623                    error=(
   624                        f"[timeout] Claude timed out after "
   625                        f"{claude_result.wall_clock_seconds:.1f}s"
   626                    ),
   627                    exit_code=claude_result.exit_code,
   628                    is_timeout=True,
   629                )
   630
   631            # Run tests  use targeted test file when available (~150s  ~15s)
   632            test_cmd = self.repo.docker.test_command
   633            if task.test_file:
   634                test_cmd = f"{test_cmd} {task.test_file}"
   635            if task.test_pattern:
   636                test_cmd = f"{test_cmd} -k '{task.test_pattern}'"
   637            if self.repo.docker.setup:
   638                setup_chain = " && ".join(self.repo.docker.setup)
   639                test_cmd = f"{setup_chain} && {test_cmd}"
   640            self._progress(task.id, cond_str, "test", f"running tests: {test_cmd}")
   641            test_result = run_in_docker(
   642                workspace,
   643                self.repo.docker.image,
   644                test_cmd,
   645                timeout=300
   646            )
   647            test_status = "PASSED" if test_result.exit_code == 0 else "FAILED"
   648            self._progress(task.id, cond_str, "test_done", f"tests {test_status}")
   649
   650            # Get diff stats
   651            self._progress(task.id, cond_str, "diff", "collecting diff stats")
   652            diff_stats = get_diff_stats(workspace)
   653
   654            # Extract which AGENTS.md files were read during the fix
   655            agents_files_read = self._extract_agents_files_read(
   656                claude_result.stdout, workspace
   657            ) if condition != Condition.NONE else None
   658
   659            return TaskResult(
   660                task_id=task.id,
   661                condition=condition,
   662                success=test_result.exit_code == 0,
   663                test_output=test_result.stdout + test_result.stderr,
   664                wall_clock_seconds=claude_result.wall_clock_seconds,
   665                input_tokens=claude_result.input_tokens,
   666                output_tokens=claude_result.output_tokens,
   667                tool_calls=claude_result.tool_calls,
   668                lines_changed=diff_stats.lines_changed,
   669                files_touched=diff_stats.files,
   670                skill_generation=skill_metrics,
   671                agents_files_read=agents_files_read,
   672                exit_code=claude_result.exit_code,
   673            )
   674        except PreValidationError as e:
   675            logger.warning("Pre-validation failed for %s (%s): %s", task.id, cond_str, e)
   676            return TaskResult(
   677                task_id=task.id,
   678                condition=condition,
   679                success=False,
   680                test_output="",
   681                wall_clock_seconds=0,
   682                input_tokens=0,
   683                output_tokens=0,
   684                tool_calls=0,
   685                lines_changed=0,
   686                files_touched=[],
   687                error=f"[pre-validation] {e}"
   688            )
   689        except SkillGenerationError as e:
   690            logger.warning("Skill generation failed for %s (%s): %s", task.id, cond_str, e)
   691            return TaskResult(
   692                task_id=task.id,
   693                condition=condition,
   694                success=False,
   695                test_output="",
   696                wall_clock_seconds=0,
   697                input_tokens=0,
   698                output_tokens=0,
   699                tool_calls=0,
   700                lines_changed=0,
   701                files_touched=[],
   702                error=f"[skill-generation] {e}"
   703            )
   704        except Exception as e:
   705            logger.error("Infrastructure error in task %s (%s): %s", task.id, cond_str, e, exc_info=True)
   706            return TaskResult(
   707                task_id=task.id,
   708                condition=condition,
   709                success=False,
   710                test_output="",
   711                wall_clock_seconds=0,
   712                input_tokens=0,
   713                output_tokens=0,
   714                tool_calls=0,
   715                lines_changed=0,
   716                files_touched=[],
   717                error=f"[infrastructure] {e}"
   718            )
   719
   720    def _setup_workspace(self, task: Task, condition: Condition, rep: int = 0) -> str:
   721        """Create workspace directory for this run.
   722
   723        Includes rep index in the path to avoid collisions when running
   724        multiple repetitions in parallel.
   725        """
   726        repo_name = self.repo.url.split("/")[-1].replace(".git", "")
   727        # Include task ID hash to avoid collisions when tasks share a commit
   728        task_hash = format(hash(task.id) % 0xFFFF, '04x')
   729        workspace_name = f"{repo_name}-{task.pre_fix_commit[:8]}-{task_hash}-{condition.value}-r{rep}"
   730        workspace = self.workspaces_dir / workspace_name
   731
   732        # Clean if exists
   733        if workspace.exists():
   734            shutil.rmtree(workspace)
   735
   736        return str(workspace)
   737
   738    def _build_prompt(self, task: Task, workspace: str, condition: Condition, cached_test_output: str | None = None) -> str:
   739        """Build the appropriate prompt based on task config.
   740
   741        Args:
   742            cached_test_output: Pre-validation test output to reuse for
   743                failing_test prompts, avoiding a redundant Docker run.
   744        """
   745        preamble = {
   746            Condition.NONE: None,
   747            Condition.FLAT_LLM: FLAT_PREAMBLE,
   748            Condition.INTENT_LAYER: INTENT_LAYER_PREAMBLE,
   749        }[condition]
   750
   751        if task.prompt_source == "commit_message":
   752            message = get_commit_message(workspace, task.fix_commit)
   753            return build_prompt_from_commit_message(message, preamble=preamble)
   754
   755        elif task.prompt_source == "failing_test":
   756            # Reuse pre-validation output if available (saves ~12s Docker run)
   757            if cached_test_output:
   758                return build_prompt_from_failing_test(
   759                    cached_test_output, preamble=preamble
   760                )
   761
   762            # Fallback: run Docker to get test output
   763            if task.test_file:
   764                test_cmd = f"{self.repo.docker.test_command} {task.test_file}"
   765            else:
   766                test_cmd = self.repo.docker.test_command
   767            if task.test_pattern:
   768                test_cmd = f"{test_cmd} -k '{task.test_pattern}'"
   769
   770            if self.repo.docker.setup:
   771                setup_chain = " && ".join(self.repo.docker.setup)
   772                test_cmd = f"{setup_chain} && {test_cmd}"
   773
   774            result = run_in_docker(
   775                workspace,
   776                self.repo.docker.image,
   777                test_cmd,
   778                timeout=PRE_VALIDATION_TIMEOUT
   779            )
   780            return build_prompt_from_failing_test(
   781                result.stdout + result.stderr, preamble=preamble
   782            )
   783
   784        elif task.prompt_source == "issue":
   785            # TODO: Implement GitHub issue fetching
   786            raise NotImplementedError("Issue-based prompts not yet implemented")
   787
   788        else:
   789            raise ValueError(f"Unknown prompt_source: {task.prompt_source}")
   790
   791    def _find_agents_files(self, workspace: str) -> list[str]:
   792        """Find all AGENTS.md and CLAUDE.md files in workspace."""
   793        workspace_path = Path(workspace)
   794        files = []
   795        for pattern in ["CLAUDE.md", "**/AGENTS.md"]:
   796            for match in workspace_path.glob(pattern):
   797                # Return path relative to workspace
   798                files.append(str(match.relative_to(workspace_path)))
   799        return sorted(files)
   800
   801    def _extract_agents_files_read(self, claude_output: str, workspace: str) -> list[str]:
   802        """Extract which AGENTS.md/CLAUDE.md files Claude read from JSON output.
   803
   804        Handles both output formats:
   805        - List of messages (array at top level)
   806        - Dict with "messages" key
   807        """
   808        files_read = set()
   809        try:
   810            data = json.loads(claude_output)
   811
   812            # Determine messages list based on output format
   813            if isinstance(data, list):
   814                messages = data
   815            elif isinstance(data, dict):
   816                messages = data.get("messages", [])
   817            else:
   818                messages = []
   819
   820            for msg in messages:
   821                if isinstance(msg, dict):
   822                    content = msg.get("content", [])
   823                    if isinstance(content, list):
   824                        for block in content:
   825                            if isinstance(block, dict) and block.get("type") == "tool_use":
   826                                if block.get("name") == "Read":
   827                                    inp = block.get("input", {})
   828                                    file_path = inp.get("file_path", "") if isinstance(inp, dict) else ""
   829                                    # Check if it's an AGENTS.md or CLAUDE.md file
   830                                    if re.search(r"(AGENTS|CLAUDE)\.md$", file_path):
   831                                        # Make relative to workspace
   832                                        if file_path.startswith(workspace):
   833                                            file_path = file_path[len(workspace):].lstrip("/")
   834                                        files_read.add(file_path)
   835        except (json.JSONDecodeError, TypeError, KeyError, AttributeError):
   836            pass
   837
   838        return sorted(files_read)
   839

# lib/task_runner.py
from __future__ import annotations
import json
import logging
import os
import re
import subprocess
import tempfile
import shutil
import sys
import time
from dataclasses import dataclass, field
from enum import Enum
from pathlib import Path
from typing import Callable

logger = logging.getLogger(__name__)

from lib.models import Task, RepoConfig
from lib.git_ops import clone_repo, checkout_commit, get_commit_message, get_diff_stats, create_baseline_commit
from lib.docker_runner import run_in_docker
from lib.claude_runner import run_claude
from lib.prompt_builder import (
    build_prompt_from_commit_message,
    build_prompt_from_failing_test,
    build_prompt_from_issue,
    FLAT_PREAMBLE,
    INTENT_LAYER_PREAMBLE,
)
from lib.index_cache import IndexCache


# Progress callback type: (task_id, condition, step, message) -> None
ProgressCallback = Callable[[str, str, str, str], None]

# Pre-validation timeout: Docker setup + test run must complete within this.
# 120s was too tight for repos with slow test setup (e.g., test_pagination.py
# under parallel Docker load). 180s gives headroom without masking real issues.
PRE_VALIDATION_TIMEOUT = 180


class Condition(Enum):
    NONE = "none"
    FLAT_LLM = "flat_llm"
    INTENT_LAYER = "intent_layer"


@dataclass
class SkillGenerationMetrics:
    wall_clock_seconds: float
    input_tokens: int
    output_tokens: int
    cache_hit: bool = False
    files_created: list[str] = field(default_factory=list)


@dataclass
class TaskResult:
    task_id: str
    condition: Condition
    success: bool
    test_output: str
    wall_clock_seconds: float
    input_tokens: int
    output_tokens: int
    tool_calls: int
    lines_changed: int
    files_touched: list[str]
    skill_generation: SkillGenerationMetrics | None = None
    agents_files_read: list[str] | None = None
    error: str | None = None
    exit_code: int | None = None
    is_timeout: bool = False


class PreValidationError(Exception):
    """Raised when a task fails pre-validation checks."""
    pass


class SkillGenerationError(Exception):
    """Raised when skill generation fails (timeout or empty output)."""
    pass


class TaskRunner:
    def __init__(
        self,
        repo: RepoConfig,
        workspaces_dir: str,
        progress_callback: ProgressCallback | None = None,
        cache_dir: str = "workspaces/.index-cache",
        use_cache: bool = True
    ):
        self.repo = repo
        self.workspaces_dir = Path(workspaces_dir)
        self.workspaces_dir.mkdir(parents=True, exist_ok=True)
        self.progress_callback = progress_callback
        self.index_cache = IndexCache(cache_dir) if use_cache else None

    def _progress(self, task_id: str, condition: str, step: str, message: str = ""):
        """Report progress if callback is set."""
        if self.progress_callback:
            self.progress_callback(task_id, condition, step, message)

    def _pre_validate(self, task: Task, workspace: str) -> str | None:
        """Validate that a task is runnable before spending API tokens.

        Checks:
        1. Docker setup commands succeed (deps install correctly)
        2. For failing_test tasks: the target test actually fails at pre_fix_commit
        3. Context files were fully stripped (no stale AGENTS.md/CLAUDE.md)

        Returns the test output (stdout+stderr) for failing_test tasks so it
        can be reused for prompt building, avoiding a redundant Docker run.
        Returns None for non-test tasks (commit_message smoke tests).

        Raises PreValidationError with a descriptive message on failure.
        """
        test_output = None

        # 1. Verify test infrastructure
        if task.prompt_source != "failing_test" and not task.test_file:
            # commit_message tasks without test_file: just verify setup works.
            # Running the full suite here is too slow and risks timeouts.
            if self.repo.docker.setup:
                setup_chain = " && ".join(self.repo.docker.setup)
                smoke_cmd = f"{setup_chain} && python --version"
            else:
                smoke_cmd = "python --version"

            result = run_in_docker(
                workspace, self.repo.docker.image, smoke_cmd, timeout=PRE_VALIDATION_TIMEOUT
            )
            if result.timed_out:
                raise PreValidationError(
                    "Docker setup timed out during pre-validation."
                )
            if result.exit_code != 0:
                raise PreValidationError(
                    f"Docker setup failed (exit {result.exit_code})."
                )
        else:
            # Run specific test file or full suite
            test_cmd = self.repo.docker.test_command
            if task.test_file:
                test_cmd = f"{test_cmd} {task.test_file}"
            if task.test_pattern:
                test_cmd = f"{test_cmd} -k '{task.test_pattern}'"

            if self.repo.docker.setup:
                setup_chain = " && ".join(self.repo.docker.setup)
                test_cmd = f"{setup_chain} && {test_cmd}"

            result = run_in_docker(
                workspace, self.repo.docker.image, test_cmd, timeout=PRE_VALIDATION_TIMEOUT
            )

            # 2. The test MUST fail at pre_fix_commit (that's the whole point)
            if task.prompt_source == "failing_test" and result.exit_code == 0:
                raise PreValidationError(
                    f"Test already passes at pre_fix_commit {task.pre_fix_commit[:8]}. "
                    f"This task is not a valid failing-test scenario."
                )

            if result.timed_out:
                raise PreValidationError(
                    "Test command timed out during pre-validation. "
                    "Docker setup or test infrastructure may be broken."
                )

            # Save test output for prompt building (avoids redundant Docker run)
            test_output = result.stdout + result.stderr

        # 3. Verify no residual context files (strip worked)
        workspace_path = Path(workspace)
        residual = []
        for pattern in ["**/AGENTS.md", "**/CLAUDE.md"]:
            for match in workspace_path.glob(pattern):
                residual.append(str(match.relative_to(workspace_path)))
        if residual:
            raise PreValidationError(
                f"Context files remain after stripping: {residual}. "
                f"Check strip_extra config."
            )

        return test_output

    def _strip_context_files(self, workspace: str, strip_extra: list[str] | None = None) -> list[str]:
        """Remove AI context files from workspace. Returns list of removed paths.

        Uses the paper's exact universal pattern (agentbench.py:59-64):
          find . -type f ( -name "AGENTS.md" -o -name "CLAUDE.md" ) -delete
          rm -rf .github

        Per-repo extras (e.g., .cursorrules, .codex/) are handled via strip_extra.
        """
        removed = []
        workspace_path = Path(workspace)

        # Universal: remove all AGENTS.md and CLAUDE.md files
        for pattern in ["**/AGENTS.md", "**/CLAUDE.md"]:
            for match in workspace_path.glob(pattern):
                rel = str(match.relative_to(workspace_path))
                match.unlink()
                removed.append(rel)

        # Universal: remove .github directory
        github_dir = workspace_path / ".github"
        if github_dir.exists():
            shutil.rmtree(github_dir)
            removed.append(".github")

        # Per-repo extras
        if strip_extra:
            resolved_workspace = workspace_path.resolve()
            for extra in strip_extra:
                target = (workspace_path / extra).resolve()
                if not target.is_relative_to(resolved_workspace):
                    continue
                if target.is_file():
                    target.unlink()
                    removed.append(extra)
                elif target.is_dir():
                    shutil.rmtree(target)
                    removed.append(extra)

        return sorted(set(removed))

    def _inject_test_from_fix(self, task: Task, workspace: str) -> bool:
        """Inject test file from fix_commit into pre_fix workspace.

        Many repos add test functions alongside code fixes. The test file may
        exist at pre_fix_commit but without the functions that reproduce the bug.
        Injecting the fix_commit version creates a valid failing-test scenario:
        the new test functions fail because the code hasn't been fixed yet.

        Returns True if injection was performed.
        """
        if not task.test_file or not task.fix_commit:
            return False

        try:
            result = subprocess.run(
                ["git", "show", f"{task.fix_commit}:{task.test_file}"],
                capture_output=True, text=True, check=True,
                cwd=workspace
            )
            test_path = Path(workspace) / task.test_file
            test_path.parent.mkdir(parents=True, exist_ok=True)
            test_path.write_text(result.stdout)
            return True
        except subprocess.CalledProcessError:
            return False

    def _check_or_generate_index(
        self,
        workspace: str,
        repo_url: str,
        commit: str,
        condition: str = "",
        model: str | None = None,
        timeout: int = 600,
        repo_level: bool = False
    ) -> SkillGenerationMetrics:
        """Check cache or generate index. Returns metrics.

        Args:
            workspace: Path to workspace where index should be
            repo_url: Repository URL
            commit: Commit SHA
            timeout: Generation timeout in seconds (default 600)
            repo_level: If True, use repo-level cache key (no commit)

        Returns:
            SkillGenerationMetrics with cache_hit flag
        """
        # Check cache if enabled  try repo-level first, then per-commit
        if self.index_cache:
            cache_entry = self.index_cache.lookup_repo(repo_url, condition)
            if not cache_entry:
                cache_entry = self.index_cache.lookup(repo_url, commit, condition)

            if cache_entry:
                # Cache hit: restore files
                start = time.time()
                self.index_cache.restore(cache_entry, workspace)
                elapsed = time.time() - start

                return SkillGenerationMetrics(
                    wall_clock_seconds=elapsed,
                    input_tokens=0,
                    output_tokens=0,
                    cache_hit=True,
                    files_created=cache_entry.agents_files
                )

        # Cache miss: generate index using the actual Intent Layer skill
        from lib.prompt_builder import build_skill_generation_prompt

        # Resolve plugin root (this repo) so scripts are findable
        plugin_root = str(Path(__file__).resolve().parent.parent.parent)

        # Write stderr to a log file so callers can tail for live progress
        log_dir = Path(self.workspaces_dir).parent / "logs"
        repo_slug = repo_url.split("/")[-1].replace(".git", "")
        stderr_log = log_dir / f"{repo_slug}-{commit[:8]}-skill_gen.log"

        prompt = build_skill_generation_prompt(plugin_root)
        result = run_claude(
            workspace, prompt, timeout=timeout, model=model,
            extra_env={"CLAUDE_PLUGIN_ROOT": plugin_root},
            stderr_log=str(stderr_log),
        )

        # Find generated AGENTS.md files
        agents_files = self._find_agents_files(workspace)

        # Save to cache if enabled
        if self.index_cache:
            self.index_cache.save(repo_url, commit, workspace, agents_files, condition, repo_level=repo_level)

        return SkillGenerationMetrics(
            wall_clock_seconds=result.wall_clock_seconds,
            input_tokens=result.input_tokens,
            output_tokens=result.output_tokens,
            cache_hit=False,
            files_created=agents_files
        )

    def _generate_flat_context(
        self,
        workspace: str,
        repo_url: str,
        commit: str,
        model: str | None = None,
        timeout: int = 600,
        repo_level: bool = False
    ) -> SkillGenerationMetrics:
        """Generate a flat CLAUDE.md using the paper's prompt. Returns metrics.

        After generation, dual-writes the content to both CLAUDE.md and AGENTS.md,
        matching the paper's behavior at init_planner.py:187-188.
        """
        # Check cache  try repo-level first, then per-commit
        if self.index_cache:
            cache_entry = self.index_cache.lookup_repo(repo_url, "flat_llm")
            if not cache_entry:
                cache_entry = self.index_cache.lookup(repo_url, commit, "flat_llm")
            if cache_entry:
                start = time.time()
                self.index_cache.restore(cache_entry, workspace)
                elapsed = time.time() - start
                return SkillGenerationMetrics(
                    wall_clock_seconds=elapsed,
                    input_tokens=0,
                    output_tokens=0,
                    cache_hit=True,
                    files_created=cache_entry.agents_files
                )

        from lib.prompt_builder import build_flat_generation_prompt

        # Write stderr to a log file so callers can tail for live progress
        log_dir = Path(self.workspaces_dir).parent / "logs"
        repo_slug = repo_url.split("/")[-1].replace(".git", "")
        stderr_log = log_dir / f"{repo_slug}-{commit[:8]}-flat_gen.log"

        prompt = build_flat_generation_prompt()
        result = run_claude(workspace, prompt, timeout=timeout, model=model,
                            stderr_log=str(stderr_log))

        # Dual-write: ensure both CLAUDE.md and AGENTS.md exist with same content
        workspace_path = Path(workspace)
        claude_md = workspace_path / "CLAUDE.md"
        agents_md = workspace_path / "AGENTS.md"

        # Claude should have created CLAUDE.md; copy to AGENTS.md
        if claude_md.exists() and not agents_md.exists():
            shutil.copy2(claude_md, agents_md)
        elif agents_md.exists() and not claude_md.exists():
            shutil.copy2(agents_md, claude_md)

        agents_files = self._find_agents_files(workspace)

        # Save to cache
        if self.index_cache:
            self.index_cache.save(repo_url, commit, workspace, agents_files, "flat_llm", repo_level=repo_level)

        return SkillGenerationMetrics(
            wall_clock_seconds=result.wall_clock_seconds,
            input_tokens=result.input_tokens,
            output_tokens=result.output_tokens,
            cache_hit=False,
            files_created=agents_files
        )

    def warm_cache(
        self,
        repo_url: str,
        condition: Condition,
        model: str | None = None,
        timeout: int = 900
    ) -> SkillGenerationMetrics | None:
        """Pre-generate context files once per repo+condition into the cache.

        Context files (AGENTS.md, CLAUDE.md) describe repo structure and
        conventions, which are stable across nearby commits. So we generate
        from the default branch once and reuse for all tasks in the repo.

        Called once per unique (repo, condition) before the task loop.
        Subsequent task runs restore from the repo-level cache entry.
        Uses a longer timeout (default 900s) since this only runs once.

        Returns SkillGenerationMetrics if generation was needed, None for the
        'none' condition (which has no context files to generate).
        """
        if condition == Condition.NONE:
            return None

        cond_key = condition.value

        # Already cached at repo level? Nothing to do.
        if self.index_cache:
            if self.index_cache.lookup_repo(repo_url, cond_key):
                logger.info("Cache hit for %s (%s), skipping warm", repo_url, condition.value)
                return None

        # Clone default branch for generation (structure is commit-agnostic)
        repo_name = repo_url.split("/")[-1].replace(".git", "")
        workspace_name = f"{repo_name}-{condition.value}-warmup"
        workspace = str(self.workspaces_dir / workspace_name)

        if Path(workspace).exists():
            shutil.rmtree(workspace)

        try:
            self._progress("warmup", condition.value, "clone", f"cloning {repo_url}")
            clone_repo(repo_url, workspace, shallow=False)
            # Use default branch HEAD  no checkout_commit needed

            self._progress("warmup", condition.value, "strip", "removing existing context files")
            strip_extra = self.repo.strip_extra or None
            self._strip_context_files(workspace, strip_extra)

            self._progress("warmup", condition.value, "generate", f"generating {condition.value} context (timeout={timeout}s)")
            if condition == Condition.INTENT_LAYER:
                metrics = self._check_or_generate_index(
                    workspace=workspace,
                    repo_url=repo_url,
                    commit="latest",
                    condition=cond_key,
                    model=model,
                    timeout=timeout,
                    repo_level=True
                )
            else:  # FLAT_LLM
                metrics = self._generate_flat_context(
                    workspace=workspace,
                    repo_url=repo_url,
                    commit="latest",
                    model=model,
                    timeout=timeout,
                    repo_level=True
                )

            if not metrics.cache_hit and not metrics.files_created:
                raise SkillGenerationError(
                    f"{condition.value} generation produced no files "
                    f"(took {metrics.wall_clock_seconds:.0f}s). "
                    f"Likely timed out or failed silently."
                )

            status = "cached" if metrics.cache_hit else f"generated {len(metrics.files_created)} file(s)"
            self._progress("warmup", condition.value, "done", f"{status} in {metrics.wall_clock_seconds:.1f}s")
            return metrics

        finally:
            # Clean up warmup workspace  the files are in the cache now
            if Path(workspace).exists():
                shutil.rmtree(workspace)

    def run(self, task: Task, condition: Condition, model: str | None = None, rep: int = 0) -> TaskResult:
        """Execute a single task under the given condition."""
        cond_str = condition.value
        self._progress(task.id, cond_str, "setup", "creating workspace")
        workspace = self._setup_workspace(task, condition, rep=rep)

        try:
            # Setup: clone and checkout
            self._progress(task.id, cond_str, "clone", f"cloning {self.repo.url}")
            clone_repo(self.repo.url, workspace, shallow=False)
            self._progress(task.id, cond_str, "checkout", f"checking out {task.pre_fix_commit[:8]}")
            checkout_commit(workspace, task.pre_fix_commit)

            # Strip context files (all conditions  paper's methodology)
            self._progress(task.id, cond_str, "strip", "removing existing context files")
            strip_extra = self.repo.strip_extra or None
            removed = self._strip_context_files(workspace, strip_extra)
            if removed:
                self._progress(task.id, cond_str, "strip_done", f"removed {len(removed)} file(s)")

            # Inject test file from fix commit for failing_test tasks.
            # Many repos add test functions alongside code fixes, so the test
            # file at pre_fix_commit passes (the bug-reproducing tests haven't
            # been written yet). Injecting fix_commit's version gives us
            # those functions, which fail because the code hasn't been fixed.
            if task.prompt_source == "failing_test" and task.test_file:
                if self._inject_test_from_fix(task, workspace):
                    self._progress(task.id, cond_str, "inject_test",
                                   f"injected {task.test_file} from fix commit")

            # Pre-validate: confirm test infra works and test actually fails
            self._progress(task.id, cond_str, "pre_validate", "verifying test fails at pre_fix_commit")
            pre_validate_output = self._pre_validate(task, workspace)
            self._progress(task.id, cond_str, "pre_validate_done", "pre-validation passed")

            # Generate context based on condition
            skill_metrics = None

            if condition == Condition.INTENT_LAYER:
                log_dir = Path(self.workspaces_dir).parent / "logs"
                repo_slug = self.repo.url.split("/")[-1].replace(".git", "")
                skill_log = log_dir / f"{repo_slug}-{task.pre_fix_commit[:8]}-skill_gen.log"
                self._progress(task.id, cond_str, "skill_gen", f"checking cache or generating Intent Layer... (tail -f {skill_log})")
                skill_metrics = self._check_or_generate_index(
                    workspace=workspace,
                    repo_url=self.repo.url,
                    commit=task.pre_fix_commit,
                    condition=condition.value,
                    model=model
                )
                if not skill_metrics.cache_hit and not skill_metrics.files_created:
                    raise SkillGenerationError(
                        f"Intent Layer generation produced no files "
                        f"(took {skill_metrics.wall_clock_seconds:.0f}s). "
                        f"Likely timed out or failed silently."
                    )
                cache_status = "restored from cache" if skill_metrics.cache_hit else "generated"
                self._progress(task.id, cond_str, "skill_gen_done", f"{cache_status} {len(skill_metrics.files_created)} file(s) in {skill_metrics.wall_clock_seconds:.1f}s")

            elif condition == Condition.FLAT_LLM:
                log_dir = Path(self.workspaces_dir).parent / "logs"
                repo_slug = self.repo.url.split("/")[-1].replace(".git", "")
                flat_log = log_dir / f"{repo_slug}-{task.pre_fix_commit[:8]}-flat_gen.log"
                self._progress(task.id, cond_str, "flat_gen", f"checking cache or generating flat CLAUDE.md... (tail -f {flat_log})")
                skill_metrics = self._generate_flat_context(
                    workspace=workspace,
                    repo_url=self.repo.url,
                    commit=task.pre_fix_commit,
                    model=model
                )
                if not skill_metrics.cache_hit and not skill_metrics.files_created:
                    raise SkillGenerationError(
                        f"Flat CLAUDE.md generation produced no files "
                        f"(took {skill_metrics.wall_clock_seconds:.0f}s). "
                        f"Likely timed out or failed silently."
                    )
                cache_status = "restored from cache" if skill_metrics.cache_hit else "generated"
                self._progress(task.id, cond_str, "flat_gen_done", f"{cache_status} {len(skill_metrics.files_created)} file(s) in {skill_metrics.wall_clock_seconds:.1f}s")

            # NONE: no generation, stripping already happened

            # Baseline commit: snapshot workspace state so diff stats
            # only measure changes made by Claude, not by the harness
            create_baseline_commit(workspace)

            # Build prompt with condition-appropriate preamble
            self._progress(task.id, cond_str, "prompt", "building prompt")
            prompt = self._build_prompt(task, workspace, condition, cached_test_output=pre_validate_output)

            # Run Claude on the task
            log_dir = Path(self.workspaces_dir).parent / "logs"
            repo_slug = self.repo.url.split("/")[-1].replace(".git", "")
            fix_log = log_dir / f"{repo_slug}-{task.pre_fix_commit[:8]}-{cond_str}-fix.log"
            self._progress(task.id, cond_str, "claude", f"running Claude to fix the bug... (tail -f {fix_log})")
            claude_result = run_claude(workspace, prompt, model=model,
                                       stderr_log=str(fix_log))
            self._progress(task.id, cond_str, "claude_done", f"completed in {claude_result.wall_clock_seconds:.1f}s, {claude_result.tool_calls} tool calls")

            # Detect empty runs: Claude returned without doing any work
            if (claude_result.tool_calls == 0
                    and claude_result.input_tokens == 0
                    and claude_result.output_tokens == 0
                    and not claude_result.timed_out):
                # Include stderr for diagnosis  often reveals why CLI failed
                stderr_snippet = claude_result.stderr.strip()[:200] if claude_result.stderr else ""
                stderr_info = f", stderr={stderr_snippet!r}" if stderr_snippet else ""
                prompt_size = len(prompt.encode("utf-8"))
                return TaskResult(
                    task_id=task.id,
                    condition=condition,
                    success=False,
                    test_output="",
                    wall_clock_seconds=claude_result.wall_clock_seconds,
                    input_tokens=0,
                    output_tokens=0,
                    tool_calls=0,
                    lines_changed=0,
                    files_touched=[],
                    error=(
                        f"[empty-run] Claude produced no output "
                        f"(exit_code={claude_result.exit_code}, "
                        f"{claude_result.wall_clock_seconds:.1f}s, "
                        f"prompt_bytes={prompt_size}{stderr_info})"
                    ),
                    exit_code=claude_result.exit_code,
                )

            # Detect timeout: Claude ran out of time
            if claude_result.timed_out:
                return TaskResult(
                    task_id=task.id,
                    condition=condition,
                    success=False,
                    test_output="",
                    wall_clock_seconds=claude_result.wall_clock_seconds,
                    input_tokens=claude_result.input_tokens,
                    output_tokens=claude_result.output_tokens,
                    tool_calls=claude_result.tool_calls,
                    lines_changed=0,
                    files_touched=[],
                    error=(
                        f"[timeout] Claude timed out after "
                        f"{claude_result.wall_clock_seconds:.1f}s"
                    ),
                    exit_code=claude_result.exit_code,
                    is_timeout=True,
                )

            # Run tests  use targeted test file when available (~150s  ~15s)
            test_cmd = self.repo.docker.test_command
            if task.test_file:
                test_cmd = f"{test_cmd} {task.test_file}"
            if task.test_pattern:
                test_cmd = f"{test_cmd} -k '{task.test_pattern}'"
            if self.repo.docker.setup:
                setup_chain = " && ".join(self.repo.docker.setup)
                test_cmd = f"{setup_chain} && {test_cmd}"
            self._progress(task.id, cond_str, "test", f"running tests: {test_cmd}")
            test_result = run_in_docker(
                workspace,
                self.repo.docker.image,
                test_cmd,
                timeout=300
            )
            test_status = "PASSED" if test_result.exit_code == 0 else "FAILED"
            self._progress(task.id, cond_str, "test_done", f"tests {test_status}")

            # Get diff stats
            self._progress(task.id, cond_str, "diff", "collecting diff stats")
            diff_stats = get_diff_stats(workspace)

            # Extract which AGENTS.md files were read during the fix
            agents_files_read = self._extract_agents_files_read(
                claude_result.stdout, workspace
            ) if condition != Condition.NONE else None

            return TaskResult(
                task_id=task.id,
                condition=condition,
                success=test_result.exit_code == 0,
                test_output=test_result.stdout + test_result.stderr,
                wall_clock_seconds=claude_result.wall_clock_seconds,
                input_tokens=claude_result.input_tokens,
                output_tokens=claude_result.output_tokens,
                tool_calls=claude_result.tool_calls,
                lines_changed=diff_stats.lines_changed,
                files_touched=diff_stats.files,
                skill_generation=skill_metrics,
                agents_files_read=agents_files_read,
                exit_code=claude_result.exit_code,
            )
        except PreValidationError as e:
            logger.warning("Pre-validation failed for %s (%s): %s", task.id, cond_str, e)
            return TaskResult(
                task_id=task.id,
                condition=condition,
                success=False,
                test_output="",
                wall_clock_seconds=0,
                input_tokens=0,
                output_tokens=0,
                tool_calls=0,
                lines_changed=0,
                files_touched=[],
                error=f"[pre-validation] {e}"
            )
        except SkillGenerationError as e:
            logger.warning("Skill generation failed for %s (%s): %s", task.id, cond_str, e)
            return TaskResult(
                task_id=task.id,
                condition=condition,
                success=False,
                test_output="",
                wall_clock_seconds=0,
                input_tokens=0,
                output_tokens=0,
                tool_calls=0,
                lines_changed=0,
                files_touched=[],
                error=f"[skill-generation] {e}"
            )
        except Exception as e:
            logger.error("Infrastructure error in task %s (%s): %s", task.id, cond_str, e, exc_info=True)
            return TaskResult(
                task_id=task.id,
                condition=condition,
                success=False,
                test_output="",
                wall_clock_seconds=0,
                input_tokens=0,
                output_tokens=0,
                tool_calls=0,
                lines_changed=0,
                files_touched=[],
                error=f"[infrastructure] {e}"
            )

    def _setup_workspace(self, task: Task, condition: Condition, rep: int = 0) -> str:
        """Create workspace directory for this run.

        Includes rep index in the path to avoid collisions when running
        multiple repetitions in parallel.
        """
        repo_name = self.repo.url.split("/")[-1].replace(".git", "")
        # Include task ID hash to avoid collisions when tasks share a commit
        task_hash = format(hash(task.id) % 0xFFFF, '04x')
        workspace_name = f"{repo_name}-{task.pre_fix_commit[:8]}-{task_hash}-{condition.value}-r{rep}"
        workspace = self.workspaces_dir / workspace_name

        # Clean if exists
        if workspace.exists():
            shutil.rmtree(workspace)

        return str(workspace)

    def _build_prompt(self, task: Task, workspace: str, condition: Condition, cached_test_output: str | None = None) -> str:
        """Build the appropriate prompt based on task config.

        Args:
            cached_test_output: Pre-validation test output to reuse for
                failing_test prompts, avoiding a redundant Docker run.
        """
        preamble = {
            Condition.NONE: None,
            Condition.FLAT_LLM: FLAT_PREAMBLE,
            Condition.INTENT_LAYER: INTENT_LAYER_PREAMBLE,
        }[condition]

        if task.prompt_source == "commit_message":
            message = get_commit_message(workspace, task.fix_commit)
            return build_prompt_from_commit_message(message, preamble=preamble)

        elif task.prompt_source == "failing_test":
            # Reuse pre-validation output if available (saves ~12s Docker run)
            if cached_test_output:
                return build_prompt_from_failing_test(
                    cached_test_output, preamble=preamble
                )

            # Fallback: run Docker to get test output
            if task.test_file:
                test_cmd = f"{self.repo.docker.test_command} {task.test_file}"
            else:
                test_cmd = self.repo.docker.test_command
            if task.test_pattern:
                test_cmd = f"{test_cmd} -k '{task.test_pattern}'"

            if self.repo.docker.setup:
                setup_chain = " && ".join(self.repo.docker.setup)
                test_cmd = f"{setup_chain} && {test_cmd}"

            result = run_in_docker(
                workspace,
                self.repo.docker.image,
                test_cmd,
                timeout=PRE_VALIDATION_TIMEOUT
            )
            return build_prompt_from_failing_test(
                result.stdout + result.stderr, preamble=preamble
            )

        elif task.prompt_source == "issue":
            # TODO: Implement GitHub issue fetching
            raise NotImplementedError("Issue-based prompts not yet implemented")

        else:
            raise ValueError(f"Unknown prompt_source: {task.prompt_source}")

    def _find_agents_files(self, workspace: str) -> list[str]:
        """Find all AGENTS.md and CLAUDE.md files in workspace."""
        workspace_path = Path(workspace)
        files = []
        for pattern in ["CLAUDE.md", "**/AGENTS.md"]:
            for match in workspace_path.glob(pattern):
                # Return path relative to workspace
                files.append(str(match.relative_to(workspace_path)))
        return sorted(files)

    def _extract_agents_files_read(self, claude_output: str, workspace: str) -> list[str]:
        """Extract which AGENTS.md/CLAUDE.md files Claude read from JSON output.

        Handles both output formats:
        - List of messages (array at top level)
        - Dict with "messages" key
        """
        files_read = set()
        try:
            data = json.loads(claude_output)

            # Determine messages list based on output format
            if isinstance(data, list):
                messages = data
            elif isinstance(data, dict):
                messages = data.get("messages", [])
            else:
                messages = []

            for msg in messages:
                if isinstance(msg, dict):
                    content = msg.get("content", [])
                    if isinstance(content, list):
                        for block in content:
                            if isinstance(block, dict) and block.get("type") == "tool_use":
                                if block.get("name") == "Read":
                                    inp = block.get("input", {})
                                    file_path = inp.get("file_path", "") if isinstance(inp, dict) else ""
                                    # Check if it's an AGENTS.md or CLAUDE.md file
                                    if re.search(r"(AGENTS|CLAUDE)\.md$", file_path):
                                        # Make relative to workspace
                                        if file_path.startswith(workspace):
                                            file_path = file_path[len(workspace):].lstrip("/")
                                        files_read.add(file_path)
        except (json.JSONDecodeError, TypeError, KeyError, AttributeError):
            pass

        return sorted(files_read)

    24def _load_prior_results(json_path: str) -> tuple[set[tuple[str, str]], dict]:
    25    """Load prior results JSON file and identify passed (task_id, condition) pairs.
    26
    27    Returns (passed_pairs, prior_data) where passed_pairs is a set of
    28    (task_id, condition_key) tuples that succeeded without errors.
    29    """

    33    if "results" not in data:
    34        raise click.ClickException(f"Invalid results file: missing 'results' key in {json_path}")
    35
    36    passed = set()
    37    for task in data["results"]:
    38        task_id = task["task_id"]
    39        for cond_key in ("none", "flat_llm", "intent_layer"):
    40            cond_data = task.get(cond_key)
    41            if cond_data is None:
    42                continue
    43            if "runs" in cond_data:
    44                raise click.ClickException(
    45                    "--resume does not support multi-run results yet "
    46                    f"(found 'runs' in {task_id}/{cond_key})"
    47                )
    48            if cond_data.get("success") is True and "error" not in cond_data:
    49                passed.add((task_id, cond_key))
    50
    51    return passed, data
    52
    53
    54def _make_progress_callback(verbose: bool):
    55    """Create a progress callback that prints to stderr if verbose is enabled."""
    56    if not verbose:
    57        return None
    58
    59    def callback(task_id: str, condition: str, step: str, message: str):
    60        timestamp = datetime.now().strftime("%H:%M:%S")
    61        # Truncate task_id for readability
    62        short_id = task_id[:30] + "..." if len(task_id) > 33 else task_id
    63        with _print_lock:
    64            click.echo(f"  [{timestamp}] {short_id} ({condition}) [{step}] {message}", err=True)
    65
    66    return callback
    67
    68
    69@click.group()
    70def main():
    71    """A/B/C eval harness for Claude skills."""
    72    pass
    73
    74
    75@main.command()
    76@click.option("--repo", required=True, help="Repository URL to scan")
    77@click.option("--output", "-o", required=True, help="Output YAML file path")
    78@click.option("--since", help="Only scan commits since date (YYYY-MM-DD)")
    79@click.option("--limit", default=50, help="Max tasks to find")
    80@click.option("--docker-image", default="node:20-slim", help="Docker image for this repo")
    81@click.option("--setup", multiple=True, default=["npm install"], help="Setup commands")
    82@click.option("--test-command", default="npm test", help="Test command")
    83@click.option("--branch", default="main", help="Default branch")
    84def scan(repo, output, since, limit, docker_image, setup, test_command, branch):
    85    """Scan a repo for bug fix commits and generate task YAML."""
    86    click.echo(f"Scanning {repo}...")
    87
    88    with tempfile.TemporaryDirectory() as tmp:
    89        click.echo("Cloning repository...")
    90        clone_repo(repo, tmp, shallow=False)
    91
    92        scanner = GitScanner()
    93        tasks = scanner.scan_repo(tmp, since=since, limit=limit)
    94
    95        click.echo(f"Found {len(tasks)} bug fix commits")
    96
    97        yaml_content = scanner.generate_yaml(
    98            tasks=tasks,
    99            repo_url=repo,
   100            docker_image=docker_image,
   101            setup=list(setup),
   102            test_command=test_command,
   103            default_branch=branch
   104        )
   105
   106        Path(output).write_text(yaml_content)
   107        click.echo(f"Wrote {output}")
   108
   109
   110@main.command()
   111@click.option("--tasks", "-t", multiple=True, required=True, help="Task YAML files")
   112@click.option("--parallel", "-p", default=2, help="Number of parallel workers")
   113@click.option("--category", type=click.Choice(["simple_fix", "targeted_refactor", "complex_fix"]))
   114@click.option("--output", "-o", default="results", help="Output directory")
   115@click.option("--keep-workspaces", is_flag=True, help="Don't cleanup workspaces")
   116@click.option("--dry-run", is_flag=True, help="Show what would run")
   117@click.option("--timeout", default=300, help="Per-task timeout in seconds")
   118@click.option("--verbose", "-v", is_flag=True, help="Show detailed progress for each step")
   119@click.option("--clear-cache", is_flag=True, help="Clear index cache before running")
   120@click.option("--no-cache", is_flag=True, help="Disable index caching entirely")
   121@click.option("--cache-dir", default="workspaces/.index-cache", help="Index cache directory")
   122@click.option("--condition", "-c", multiple=True,
   123              type=click.Choice(["none", "flat_llm", "intent_layer"]),
   124              help="Conditions to run (default: all three)")
   125@click.option("--model", default=None,
   126              help="Claude model to use (e.g., claude-sonnet-4-5-20250929)")
   127@click.option("--repetitions", "-n", default=1,
   128              help="Number of times to repeat each task/condition pair (default: 1)")
   129@click.option("--resume", default=None, type=click.Path(exists=True),
   130              help="Prior results JSON  skip passed pairs, re-run failures")
   131def run(tasks, parallel, category, output, keep_workspaces, dry_run, timeout, verbose, clear_cache, no_cache, cache_dir, condition, model, repetitions, resume):
   132    """Run eval on task files."""
   133    # Validate task files exist
   134    for task_path in tasks:
   135        if not Path(task_path).exists():
   136            raise click.ClickException(f"Task file does not exist: {task_path}")
   137
   138    # Load all task files
   139    all_tasks = []
   140    for task_path in tasks:
   141        task_file = TaskFile.from_yaml(Path(task_path))
   142        for task in task_file.tasks:
   143            if category and task.category != category:
   144                continue
   145            all_tasks.append((task_file.repo, task))
   146
   147    click.echo(f"Loaded {len(all_tasks)} tasks from {len(tasks)} file(s)")
   148
   149    # Handle cache management (do this before dry-run check)
   150    if clear_cache and not no_cache:
   151        from lib.index_cache import IndexCache
   152        cache = IndexCache(cache_dir)
   153        cache.clear()
   154        click.echo(f"Cleared index cache at {cache_dir}")
   155
   156    # Determine conditions to run
   157    if condition:
   158        conditions = [Condition(c) for c in condition]
   159    else:
   160        conditions = list(Condition)
   161
   162    # Build work queue (with repetitions)
   163    work_queue = []
   164    for repo, task in all_tasks:
   165        for cond in conditions:
   166            for rep in range(repetitions):
   167                work_queue.append((repo, task, cond, rep))
   168
   169    # Filter out passed pairs from prior run
   170    passed_pairs = set()
   171    prior_data = None
   172    if resume:
   173        passed_pairs, prior_data = _load_prior_results(resume)
   174        original_len = len(work_queue)
   175        work_queue = [item for item in work_queue if (item[1].id, item[2].value) not in passed_pairs]
   176        click.echo(f"Resume: {len(passed_pairs)} passed pairs carried forward, {len(work_queue)}/{original_len} to re-run")
   177
   178    if dry_run:
   179        click.echo("\nDry run - would execute:")
   180        for _repo, task, cond, rep in work_queue:
   181            rep_tag = f" [rep {rep+1}]" if repetitions > 1 else ""
   182            click.echo(f"  - {task.id} ({cond.value}){rep_tag}")
   183        if not work_queue:
   184            click.echo("  (nothing to re-run)")
   185        return
   186
   187    total_unique = len(set((item[1].id, item[2].value) for item in work_queue))
   188    rep_note = f" x{repetitions} reps" if repetitions > 1 else ""
   189    click.echo(f"Running {total_unique} task/condition pairs{rep_note} ({len(work_queue)} total) with {parallel} workers")
   190    if verbose:
   191        click.echo("Verbose mode: showing detailed progress", err=True)
   192
   193    workspaces_dir = Path("workspaces")
   194    results = []
   195    progress_callback = _make_progress_callback(verbose)
   196
   197    # Phase 1: Pre-warm cache  generate context files once per repo+condition.
   198    # Context files describe repo structure/conventions, which are stable across
   199    # nearby commits. So we generate once per repo, not per task commit.
   200    # This runs serially before the parallel task loop so each generation gets
   201    # the full timeout budget. Task runs then get instant cache hits.
   202    if not no_cache:
   203        # Collect unique (repo_url, condition) pairs that need generation.
   204        warmup_items: dict[tuple[str, str], 'RepoConfig'] = {}
   205        for repo, task in all_tasks:
   206            for cond in conditions:
   207                if cond == Condition.NONE:
   208                    continue
   209                key = (repo.url, cond.value)
   210                if key not in warmup_items:
   211                    warmup_items[key] = repo
   212
   213        if warmup_items:
   214            click.echo(f"Pre-warming cache for {len(warmup_items)} repo/condition pair(s)...")
   215            for (repo_url, cond_str), repo_config in warmup_items.items():
   216                cond = Condition(cond_str)
   217                runner = TaskRunner(
   218                    repo_config,
   219                    str(workspaces_dir),
   220                    progress_callback=progress_callback,
   221                    cache_dir=cache_dir,
   222                    use_cache=True
   223                )
   224                try:
   225                    metrics = runner.warm_cache(repo_url, cond, model=model)
   226                    if metrics and not metrics.cache_hit:
   227                        click.echo(f"  {cond_str}: generated {len(metrics.files_created)} file(s) in {metrics.wall_clock_seconds:.1f}s")
   228                    else:
   229                        click.echo(f"  {cond_str}: already cached")
   230                except Exception as e:
   231                    click.echo(f"  {cond_str}: warmup failed - {e}", err=True)
   232                    click.echo(f"    (task runs will retry with their own timeout)", err=True)
   233
   234    def run_single(item):
   235        repo, task, condition, rep = item
   236        runner = TaskRunner(
   237            repo,
   238            str(workspaces_dir),
   239            progress_callback=progress_callback,
   240            cache_dir=cache_dir,
   241            use_cache=not no_cache
   242        )
   243        return runner.run(task, condition, model=model, rep=rep)
   244
   245    with ThreadPoolExecutor(max_workers=parallel) as executor:
   246        futures = {executor.submit(run_single, item): item for item in work_queue}
   247
   248        for future in as_completed(futures):
   249            item = futures[future]
   250            _repo, _task, _cond, rep = item
   251            try:
   252                result = future.result()
   253            except Exception as e:
   254                # Worker crashed (e.g., cache race, OOM)  record as infra error
   255                click.echo(f"  {_task.id} ({_cond.value}): CRASH - {e}", err=True)
   256                result = TaskResult(
   257                    task_id=_task.id,
   258                    condition=_cond,
   259                    success=False,
   260                    test_output="",
   261                    wall_clock_seconds=0,
   262                    input_tokens=0,
   263                    output_tokens=0,
   264                    tool_calls=0,
   265                    lines_changed=0,
   266                    files_touched=[],
   267                    error=f"[worker-crash] {e}"
   268                )
   269            results.append(result)
   270            status = "PASS" if result.success else "FAIL"
   271            # Build the status line with error info if failed
   272            rep_tag = f" [rep {rep+1}/{repetitions}]" if repetitions > 1 else ""
   273            line = f"  {result.task_id} ({result.condition.value}){rep_tag}: {status}"
   274            if not result.success:
   275                if result.error:
   276                    # Exception during execution - show first line
   277                    error_line = result.error.split('\n')[0][:80]
   278                    line += f" - {error_line}"
   279                elif result.test_output:
   280                    # Tests failed - extract last meaningful line from output
   281                    output_lines = [l.strip() for l in result.test_output.strip().split('\n') if l.strip()]
   282                    if output_lines:
   283                        last_line = output_lines[-1][:80]
   284                        line += f" - {last_line}"
   285            click.echo(line)
   286            # In verbose mode, show more error context for failures
   287            if verbose and not result.success:
   288                if result.error:
   289                    click.echo(f"    Error: {result.error}", err=True)
   290                elif result.test_output:
   291                    # Show last 10 lines of test output
   292                    output_lines = result.test_output.strip().split('\n')
   293                    tail = output_lines[-10:] if len(output_lines) > 10 else output_lines
   294                    click.echo("    Test output (last 10 lines):", err=True)
   295                    for l in tail:
   296                        click.echo(f"      {l}", err=True)
   297
   298    # Generate reports
   299    reporter = Reporter(output)
   300    eval_results = reporter.compile_results(results)
   301
   302    # Merge with prior results if resuming
   303    if prior_data is not None:
   304        eval_results = _merge_results(eval_results, prior_data, passed_pairs)
   305
   306    json_path = reporter.write_json(eval_results)
   307    md_path = reporter.write_markdown(eval_results)
   308
   309    click.echo(f"\nResults written to:")
   310    click.echo(f"  JSON: {json_path}")
   311    click.echo(f"  Markdown: {md_path}")
   312
   313    # Cleanup workspaces but preserve index cache
   314    if not keep_workspaces and workspaces_dir.exists():
   315        import shutil
   316        cache_path = Path(cache_dir)
   317        # Move cache out, remove workspaces, move cache back
   318        tmp_cache = None
   319        if cache_path.exists() and cache_path.is_relative_to(workspaces_dir):
   320            tmp_cache = workspaces_dir.parent / ".index-cache-preserve"
   321            if tmp_cache.exists():
   322                shutil.rmtree(tmp_cache)
   323            shutil.move(str(cache_path), str(tmp_cache))
   324        shutil.rmtree(workspaces_dir)
   325        if tmp_cache and tmp_cache.exists():
   326            cache_path.parent.mkdir(parents=True, exist_ok=True)
   327            shutil.move(str(tmp_cache), str(cache_path))
   328        click.echo("Cleaned up workspaces")
   329
   330
   331if __name__ == "__main__":
   332    main()
   333

# lib/docker_runner.py
from __future__ import annotations
import os
import subprocess
from dataclasses import dataclass


@dataclass
class DockerResult:
    exit_code: int
    stdout: str
    stderr: str
    timed_out: bool = False


def run_in_docker(
    workspace: str,
    image: str,
    command: str,
    timeout: int = 120,
    memory: str = "4g",
    cpus: str = "2"
) -> DockerResult:
    """Run a command in a Docker container with workspace mounted."""
    # Docker requires absolute paths for bind mounts
    abs_workspace = os.path.abspath(workspace)
    cmd = [
        "docker", "run", "--rm",
        "-v", f"{abs_workspace}:/work",
        "-w", "/work",
        "--network", "host",
        "--memory", memory,
        "--cpus", cpus,
        image,
        "sh", "-c", command
    ]

    try:
        result = subprocess.run(
            cmd,
            capture_output=True,
            text=True,
            timeout=timeout
        )
        return DockerResult(
            exit_code=result.returncode,
            stdout=result.stdout,
            stderr=result.stderr,
            timed_out=False
        )
    except subprocess.TimeoutExpired:
        return DockerResult(
            exit_code=-1,
            stdout="",
            stderr="Command timed out",
            timed_out=True
        )

    632. High-level code architecture and structure so that future instances can be productive more quickly. Focus on the "big picture" architecture that requires reading multiple files to understand.

    69- Don't include generic development practices.

    71- If there is a README.md, make sure to include the important parts.

    73- Be sure to prefix the file with the following text:
    74
    75# CLAUDE.md
    76
    77This file provides guidance to Claude Code (claude.ai/code) when working with code in this repository.'''
    78
    79
    80def build_skill_generation_prompt(plugin_root: str) -> str:
    81    """Build prompt for Intent Layer generation using the actual plugin.
    82
    83    Mirrors what happens when a user invokes /intent-layer:
    84    CLAUDE_PLUGIN_ROOT is set in the env (by the caller), and the prompt
    85    gives Claude the same workflow from the skill.
    86    """
    87    return f"""Create an Intent Layer for this codebase to help future agents fix bugs.
    88
    89The Intent Layer plugin scripts are available at: {plugin_root}/scripts/
    90
    91## Step 0: Detect State
    92
    93Run: {plugin_root}/scripts/detect_state.sh .
    94
    95## Step 1: Measure
    96
    97Run: {plugin_root}/scripts/estimate_all_candidates.sh .
    98This shows which directories are large enough to warrant their own AGENTS.md.
    99
   100## Step 2: Mine Git History
   101
   102Run: {plugin_root}/scripts/mine_git_history.sh .
   103This extracts pitfalls, anti-patterns, and contracts from past bug fixes and reverts.
   104Git-mined pitfalls are the highest-value content in any node.
   105
   106## Step 3: Create Root CLAUDE.md
   107
   108Create a CLAUDE.md at the project root with these sections:
   109- **TL;DR**: One-line project description
   110- **Entry Points**: Table of common tasks and where to start
   111- **Architecture**: Components, data flow, key patterns (big picture only)
   112- **Contracts**: Non-type-enforced invariants that must hold
   113- **Pitfalls**: What looks wrong but is correct, what looks correct but breaks
   114  (include findings from git history mining)
   115- **Downlinks**: Table linking to child AGENTS.md nodes
   116
   117Rules:
   118- Keep under 4000 tokens (target 100:1 compression ratio)
   119- Don't list every file  focus on non-obvious locations
   120- Don't include generic dev practices
   121- Include how to build, test, and run the project
   122
   123## Step 4: Create Child AGENTS.md Nodes
   124
   125For each directory that has >20k tokens OR a distinct responsibility, create an AGENTS.md with:
   126- Purpose and design rationale
   127- Code map (non-obvious file locations)
   128- Key exports used by other modules
   129- Contracts specific to this area
   130- Pitfalls specific to this area (include git history findings)
   131
   132Rules:
   133- Each node under 4000 tokens
   134- Don't create nodes for simple utilities or config-only dirs
   135- Child nodes are named AGENTS.md (not CLAUDE.md)
   136
   137## Step 5: Validate
   138
   139Run: {plugin_root}/scripts/validate_node.sh CLAUDE.md
   140Run validation on each child AGENTS.md too.
   141
   142Focus on information that would help someone unfamiliar with the codebase navigate and fix bugs safely."""
   143
